page.title: 07 FOLKESTONE HARBOUR
page.content: Folkestone Harbour is owned by Sealink British Ferries. Together with their operation of the cross-Channel ferries, this makes the company one of the largest employers in the district. About 280 people work in the harbour area. The commercial part of the harbour has the facilities for handling passengers arriving by train at the harbour station and vehicles for loading on board the ferries for the crossing to France. The new Orient Express train uses Folkestone Harbour, travelling from London on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The other part of the harbour is very picturesque and is used by fishing boats and private vessels. It is always popular with tourists, as many colourful boats can be seen. .MIT/04520319
